New Records: Breel Embolo scored in added time to complete Switzerland’s 3-1 win over Hungary in both teams’ first game of the European Championship on Saturday, marking a triumphant personal comeback after 18 months of injuries.
Key Match Events: Kwadwo Duah opened the scoring in just his second game for Switzerland, shooting low past goalkeeper Peter Gulacsi off a pass from Michel Aebischer.
Michel Aebischer made it 2-0 just before halftime, finding space on the edge of the box to hit a curling low shot past Gulacsi.
Barnabas Varga’s diving header in the 66th off Dominik Szoboszlai’s cross brought celebrations for Hungary as some of its black T-shirt-wearing hardcore fans lit flares.
Breel Embolo scored in added time to complete Switzerland’s 3-1 win over Hungary.
Pre-Game Insights: Switzerland coach Murat Yakin picked forward Kwadwo Duah and midfielder Michel Aebischer in his starting lineup, and they both scored.
Hungary coach Marco Rossi said his team was “too passive” in the first half and a “tactical misunderstanding” allowed Aebischer too much time on the ball to shape Swiss attacks.
Post-Match Reflections: Swiss coach Murat Yakin said of Embolo: “It was a very uncertain situation after the very serious, long injury and another injury after that. We had hope.”
Captain Granit Xhaka said Embolo was “a very, very important player for our team, both on the field and off the field.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Switzerland is second in Group A after host Germany beat Scotland 5-1 on Friday in the tournament opener.
Hungary had its first loss in a competitive game since September 2022.
